file_content.text: The galaxy is in your debt once again, but I fear this is far from over.
When you reforge your connection to the light side, you will be a Jedi Master.
The rank of Master carries great responsibilities, but you are ready.
You saved our galaxy from destruction. The Emperor's death has turned the tide of this war.
Combined with our success on Corellia and the damage inflicted on Dromund Kaas, the Sith are in chaos. It's glorious.
For too long, the Republic has feared the Sith Empire. Today, we've proven they aren't invincible.
This was long overdue.
You raised the morale of every Republic soldier from Coruscant to Hoth.
Without the Emperor's control, the Sith might be even more dangerous and unpredictable.
It's also troubling.
Not if we keep the enemy off balance. For the first time since the war started, we have the upper hand.
Today, we avenged the Sacking of Coruscant and the destruction of the Jedi Temple.
We'll crush the Sith forever.
Now, we will tighten our grip until the last Sith is extinct and their Empire crumbles into nothing.
The Republic stands united in that cause. Even the neutral worlds rally to our side.
For your victory on Corellia, General Var Suthra recommended you all receive the Medal of Bravery. But you've earned more than that.
It is my honor to present each of you with the Republic's highest award: the Cross of Glory.
You will live forever as heroes of the Republic. Jedi Knight Kira Carsen... Sergeant Fideltin Rusk... Teeseven Oh-one... Doctor Archiban Kimble....
Archiban? Seriously?
Just call me Doc. Please.
Even you, Lord Scourge. Though you joined us for selfish reasons, you saved more lives than your own.
Scourge will be a Jedi before he knows it.
He's learning to be a hero.
Do not count on that. I remain only until I am certain the Emperor left us no surprises.
The Emperor is dead, and you're still with us. Why?
Why have you stayed, Scourge?
Where else can he go? The Sith want him dead. We're the only friends he's got.
I do not require friends or protection. I will stay until I am certain the Emperor left us no surprises.
You didn't hear him telling the others to commit suicide down on Dromund Kaas.
The man is still a Sith.
Keep your honors. I am not a citizen of your Republic--nor am I one of the Empire.
Until I am certain the Emperor left us no surprises, I will stay. Beyond that, I promise nothing.
And then there is you. How do we even begin to account for the turns your life has taken since you first arrived on Tython?
The dark side has cast its shadow over you. I sense your anger and ambition growing. I can no longer ignore it.
I wanted so much for you to become a Jedi Master, but you are not ready.
What have I done to deserve being passed over? I've saved trillions of people.
I don't understand.
Your battles on Corellia cost us Master Kiwiiks and dozens of brave Jedi. Your leadership there was questionable, at best.
How much have you sacrificed on your path to victory? What emotions drove these decisions? These are the questions we must answer.
I still have much to learn about being a Jedi.
You are right, Master.
Hearing you admit that gives me hope.
I've done more for the Republic than the whole Jedi Council combined.
That's a lie.
Please, do not make this any harder than it is.
You struck a great blow against the Sith, but the war goes on. There will be other opportunities for you to prove yourself worthy.
Master Satele, this Jedi is one of the greatest war heroes I've ever met. She deserves recognition for her victories.
Master Satele, this Jedi is one of the greatest war heroes I've ever met. He deserves recognition for his victories.
By the authority of the Supreme Chancellor, I hereby grant you the honorary rank of Republic general.
Thank you, Admiral. Maybe my destiny isn't with the Jedi Order. Being a soldier feels right.
It's a pleasure to serve.
No one salutes an "honorary" officer.
What a worthless title.
I assure you, you'll be treated with the respect you deserve. I'll see to it personally.
You could learn from the admiral, Satele. He knows how to show his appreciation.
That's more like it.
Let me be the first to salute you.
We will speak of this another time. For now, let us mourn what we have lost and celebrate all we have gained.
For this one moment, the galaxy is safe. May the Force be with us.
You embody what every Jedi strives to become. Your courage, commitment and leadership have seen us through this dark time.
From this day forward, you are no longer a Jedi Knight. You are a Jedi Master.
I will uphold the Jedi Code and bring justice to the galaxy.
Thank you, Master Satele.
That's a lot of responsibility. I'm so young, Master Satele.
Are you sure I'm ready?
Young, yes. Wise and good, even more so.
I thought you'd never get around to it.
It's about time.
Be mindful of your emotions, Master--but I appreciate your honest enthusiasm.
These are the moments we strive for, when the hope of victory becomes real. When we can see peace on the horizon.
May the Force be with us.
Master Satele, the Emperor is dead. Do you read me? The Emperor is dead.
We read you loud and clear. Imperial warships are dropping out of hyperspace all around us. We must retreat from Dromund Kaas.
Rendezvous with the Republic flagship Valiant at these coordinates. I'll meet you there. Master Satele out....
I see your crew survived without unnecessary heroics from you.
Sergeant Rusk = saved Doc // Jedi = ignored emergency alert
Doc = saved Kira // Jedi = ignored emergency alert
Kira = saved Sergeant Rusk // Jedi = ignored emergency alert
I could either save the galaxy or rescue my crew. I had to focus on the greater good.
That was a difficult choice.
I shouldn't have left it up to anyone else. You people are my responsibility.
I regret not going myself.
This crew needs to stop pretending I owe it anything. My mission is saving the galaxy, not you.
You people need to toughen up.
If sarge hadn't pulled me out of the fire, the galaxy would be down one Doc. And there's only one of me!
Do you have any idea how embarrassing it was to be rescued by that walking hormone?
The operation was successful, regardless. Kira and I inflicted heavy damage on the enemy.
What's done is done. Our orders are clear. We should set course for the flagship Valiant.
You gave the Emperor time to gather his strength. We are all fortunate to be alive.
One of my crew was in danger. If I had to make that choice again, I'd do the same thing.
I did what was right.
To repeat a mistake and expect a beneficial outcome is a sign of insanity.
Luck wasn't a factor. I trusted my instincts.
The Force was with us.
Some instincts are sharper than others.
Are you seriously criticizing me for not following your stupid plan? I just saved the galaxy, you idiot.
Don't blame me, you jerk.
It's gonna be a long flight. Somebody wake me when we get there....
Master Satele, my mission on Corellia is complete. Republic forces have gained the upper hand, and Master Braga is no longer aiding the enemy.
I successfully broke the Emperor's domination over him. Master Braga is on his way to Tython.
That is welcome news. We'll take good care of him.
The Emperor's domination of Master Braga was too strong. I had to kill him.
What a terrible loss. I'm sure you did your best.
I managed to break the Emperor's domination of him. Master Braga is now sabotaging Imperial forces from within.
I worry for him. I hope he returns here soon.
I've also learned the Emperor is on Dromund Kaas. His efforts against us have weakened him. Our enemy is vulnerable--for now.
The Emperor is determined to destroy the galaxy. It's him, or us.
You must face the Emperor again. And this time, you cannot fail.
I'm stronger than the last time we met.
I'll do my best.
The Council should join me. At the very least, you should come.
You're sending me alone?
The risk is too great. You're the only Jedi who resisted his corrupting influence. Others might fall to the dark side.
The Emperor won't survive our next meeting. That's a promise.
Consider him dead.
Be mindful of anger. It is a weapon the Emperor could easily turn against you.
Dromund Kaas is the Imperial capitol. Legions of Sith call it home. The remaining population is almost entirely Imperial military.
We're invading a planet of people who want us dead. We'll have to fight for every centimeter of ground.
We won't even be able to land on Dromund Kaas unless the enemy is too distracted to notice.
We're going to need help.
There must be some way to achieve our goal without violence. Could we disguise ourselves, somehow?
Can we sneak in?
No spy ever sent to Dromund Kaas has returned alive--and we have no time for elaborate ruses.
For once, I won't have to worry about civilian casualties.
At least I can kill everyone.
There are no civilians where we're going. Everyone you meet will be armed and will try to kill you.
We must surprise the Empire by doing what they least expect: a frontal assault on their homeworld.
Jedi and Republic warships will converge on Dromund Kaas and engage the Imperial fleet. We will mask your assault on the surface.
Master Satele, that's a suicide mission.
You'll all be killed.
If you defeat the Emperor, whatever sacrifices are required will not be in vain.
The real fight will be on the planet. Can you spare anyone for that?
What about ground troops?
We'll attract less attention without your forces stirring up the Imperial army.
When I try to land, they'll shoot me down.
That won't be enough.
I will help you navigate the planet's defense network and land safely. After that, no promises.
Your success or failure will not merely decide the galaxy's fate. It will change everything--forever.
Find the Emperor and stop him once and for all. May the Force be with you.
Admiral Dabrin and his flagship are safe, Master.
We also captured Warren alive, but you'll find he's... changed.
We were able to help Leeha Narezz. We'll find a way to help Warren.
The dark side had consumed Warren. He refused to surrender. He's dead.
I know killing a former ally must have been difficult.
Warren revealed Master Braga is on Corellia. He's the Emperor's secret weapon in the war there.
The Republic is sending everything it has to liberate Corellia. If Master Braga is aiding the enemy....
The Emperor has no interest in keeping Corellia. He desires the deaths of billions to fuel his ritual.
Find Master Braga and stop this madness. Set course for Corellia immediately.
One of our missing Jedi has resurfaced, and the news isn't good. Warren Sedoru has attacked and boarded the Republic flagship Valiant.
This is the Emperor's doing. Warren is being controlled, just like Leeha Narezz was.
Warren is just a pawn.
That hardly matters to our military. All they see is a Jedi turned traitor.
What is Warren after?
Do we know why?
How did an old, pacifist Jedi invade a battle cruiser?
He's only one man.
Warren's gift for infiltration is unmatched--and he's backed by Imperial commandos.
The Valiant is commanded by Admiral Dabrin, one of our top military leaders. He's inflicted heavy casualties on Imperial forces.
Admiral Dabrin possesses complete knowledge of the Republic's war plans. If the Imperial military gains that information, they'll crush us.
You're missing the point. The fallen Jedi serves the Emperor's agenda. We must learn his mission.
We have plenty of reasons to pursue this. Where are we headed, Master Satele?
Then let's go.
We've found Leeha and Warren, but no sign of Master Braga. Maybe Warren knows where to find him.
What about Master Braga?
Not everything missing should be found.
We've defeated the plots against Voss and Belsavis. What more can your old boss have planned?
You think there's more?
The Emperor is the most patient being in the galaxy. He's waited centuries to enact his ritual--and he's plotted for every conceivable interference.
The Valiant is drifting out of control at these coordinates. Liberate it, save the admiral and learn the Emperor's plans.
Hurry--the Valiant's crew can't hold out much longer.
Master Satele, I stopped Lord Fulminiss. He created a madness-inducing plague to turn this planet's inhabitants against each other.
If he'd succeeded, Voss would've exploded into mindless violence. The entire planet would be a slaughterhouse.
The brutality of the Sith knows no bounds.
I applaud you for a job well-done. I know it wasn't easy dealing with the Voss people.
The Voss are strange, but in the end, I needed their help to win.
I worked out a compromise.
It shows true strength to admit to needing help from others. I hope strength enough for what I must ask of you.
Voss customs are strange, but there is wisdom in much of what they believe.
The Voss aren't so bad.
That is an intriguing assessment--and the first favorable one I've heard. I will have to investigate your claim, someday.
The entire planet has been brainwashed by the Mystics. The Voss can't scratch their own noses without consulting their all-powerful rulers.
What a bunch of lunatics.
The Voss show us what happens when the power of the Force is abused. Our order may have to take action against the Mystics.
Right now, however, we have more pressing concerns.
Master Satele... I rescued Jomar and found Leeha Narezz. She's been under the Emperor's control and needs your help. They're headed for Tython now.
I also learned a high-ranking Sith named Fulminiss is on the planet Voss.
That is disturbing news. Voss was discovered only recently. Its society is dangerously unbalanced.
The people worship an elite group of Force-users who rule with absolute authority. Despite our best efforts, Voss's government rejects the Jedi Code.
The Emperor has always taken a great interest in that world. I thought he sought to conquer it, but clearly he intends its destruction.
Go to Voss. Find Lord Fulminiss and stop his plans.
There is a rumor of high-ranking Sith gathering at a remote Imperial space station, allegedly on the Emperor's orders.
One of our best scouts volunteered to investigate. He's disappeared.
Sounds like there's truth to this rumor. Tell me everything.
I should look into this.
Sneaking into enemy territory is dangerous. Who is this scout?
Who is he?
He's the man you replaced on Master Braga's strike team.
Rumors are good bait to lure a desperate Jedi.
Sounds like a trap.
That, or the rumors are correct.
Jomar Chul attempted to infiltrate the Imperial space station where the Sith are meeting and hasn't checked in since.
I know you and Jomar have had differences, but I believe he's on to something.
If the Emperor is involved, this may reveal his plans.
I agree.
After the accusations he made to the Council, I doubt he'll help me--assuming he's alive.
Jomar doesn't trust me.
My only concern is uncovering the Emperor's plans. We need to know what's happening on that station.
Don't get your hopes up. He's probably dead.
You're assuming he's alive.
Regardless, you're now our best hope of learning what's happening on that station.
This is worth pursuing.
I'm transmitting coordinates to the space station. I have no advice for getting inside.
Leave that to me.
May the Force be with you.
Master Satele, Executor Krannus and his followers are dead. Belsavis is safe.
The Emperor would never devote all his resources to Belsavis. We must find his other targets.
Anybody here a droid medic? This little guy took some rough hits. Wouldn't have made it back without him, though.
Teeseven's in bad shape. He came to help me fight some Imperials, and they hit him with an ion weapon.
Your astromech droid was severely damaged, Master Jedi. It abandoned its post to support my mission and was attacked by Imperial forces.
T7 = hero?
You sacrificed yourself to save another's life. That's the definition of a hero, Teeseven.
That's right, you're a hero.
T7 = relieved // Sacrifice = not in vain
I knew you wouldn't fail me.
You always have been.
You're no hero. You're just a machine that carried out my orders.
Don't get full of yourself.
Anybody who saves my neck is a hero. I just wish you were flesh and blood. That, I could fix.
Don't listen to that nonsense, Teeseven. You'll always be my hero.
As machines go, he's a good one.
Price of victory = T7's memory core // T7's earliest data records = lost // File corruption = permanent
I'll patch him up and stop that memory corruption before it gets worse. Let's head for the Valiant.
The Jedi I gave you to retake Corellia were nearly eradicated. At a minimum, that reflects poorly on your leadership.
For your actions on Corellia, General Var Suthra recommended you all receive the Crescent of Service. But you've earned more than that.
